statement.p: Outside temperature over a day can be modeled as a sinusoidal function. Suppose you know the temperature is 65 degrees at 6 a.m. and the high and low temperature during the day are 71 and 59 degrees, respectively. Assuming midnight is when the temperature is lowest, find an equation for the temperature, \displaystyle{T}{\left({t}\right)}, where \displaystyle{t} is the number of hours since midnight.
